Text: Monday :)
*Quiet chatting*

Speaker: You
Text: Monday mornings are always the worst.
(You sit at your desk, head down, waiting for your world history teacher, Mr. Harrison, to show up.)
*Ding Dong*

Speaker: You
Text: He's late again.

Speaker: Classmate A
Text: "It's tiiiiiime~"

Speaker: Classmate A
Text: "I'm adding another tally to the Late-ison board. Five dollars that he's gonna be more than three minutes late."

Speaker: Classmate B
Text: "Bro, who would even want to take that?"
(As your classmates start conspiring on how late Mr. Harrison will be, the classroom door opens.)
(Everyone falls silent as they turn to check who just walked in.)
"...What?"
(The students who were taking bets made sounds of a mixture of relief and annoyance and turn away.)

Speaker: Classmate B
Text: "Kit you scared us!"

Speaker: Kit
Text: "... I didn't do anything though?"

Speaker: Classmate C
Text: "Don't worry about it, Kit. It was just the usual before class betting."

Speaker: Kit
Text: "The usual before class betting?"

Speaker: Classmate D
Text: "You know, 'cuz Mr. Harrison's been consistently late for the past month or so."

Speaker: Kit
Text: "Oh, right. That bet."
(Kit furrows his brow, walks over to his seat, and gets settled in.)

Speaker: Classmate A
Text: "Man, I thought I was about to lose five dollars but it was just Kit. We're all good"
(You look around in confusion. Nobody seems to find anything strange.)

Speaker: You
Text: What the fuck is going on?
(You lean over to your right.)

Speaker: You
Text: "Hey Emily, can I ask you a question?"

Speaker: Emily
Text: "I'm really sorry, but can it wait? I forgot we had homework and I'm almost done."

Speaker: You
Text: "I'll be really quick...Did you... notice that Kit's finally back?"
(Emily stops typing and gives you a weird side-eye. She stays there for a few seconds before turning back to laptop with a huff.)

Speaker: Emily
Text: "You interrupted me for a question like that? I've lost my train of thought now."

Speaker: Emily
Text: "Where would Kit be 'finally back' from? As far as I know, he never left."

Speaker: You
Text: "Right, right, sorry for the bother. If you want I can let you copy off my answers. Mr. Harrison doesn't actually read your response anyways."

Speaker: Emily
Text: "Nah, I'm okay. I just have a few sentences left."
(You let Emily get back to her writing and open your own laptop.)

Speaker: You
Text: Am I hallucinating? I swear Kit's been gone for a loooong time now.

Speaker: You
Text: And that one time I heard his friends saying they went to go visit him and he wasn't there.
(You hastily open up a previous group project document on your laptop and check the document history.)

Speaker: You
Text: There!

Speaker: You
Text: Six weeks ago Emily deleted Kit's name off of our document and we reorganized the work to be split between three people instead of four.

Speaker: You
Text: ... But why is everyone pretending that he didn't go missing?
(The door to the classroom opens again and Mr. Harrison walks in. The class quiets down as Mr. Harrison grumpily starts class.)
(You put away your laptop before he can yell at you for having electronics out.)
(Mr. Harrison begins class and you try your best to pay attention, but for some reason all you want to do is get to the bottom of Kit's disappearance.)
Fade to black, fade back
(Throughout the day, you try to ask other people questions about Kit's whereabouts for the past month, but all answers lead you to the same conclusion.)
Nobody remembers Kit's disappearance.
At Home :P

Speaker: You
Text: "Hmmmm..."

Speaker: You
Text: I tried to catch Kit after school to ask the guy himself about his... disappearance, but his friends told me he left before last period.

Speaker: You
Text: I still want to get to the bottom of this, but I need to find a way to talk to Kit.
fade to black, scratching sounds, fade back

Speaker: You
Text: "Hehe, done!"

Speaker: You
Text: I'll just leave this on Kit's desk tomorrow morning. Hopefully he doesn't flake on me.

Speaker: You
Text: Alright... Time for some homework!
fade to black
Day of two :P
(Once again, you arrive at school for first period early and head straight to Mr. Harrison's classroom.)
(You place an origami flower envelope on Kit's desk and patiently wait for the bell to ring.)
*Ding Dong*
(Mr. Harrison bursts through the door only a few seconds after the bell rings.)

Speaker: Mr. Harrison
Text: "Alright, settle down. Get your books out, we're gonna be doing a passage analysis today. Read and analyze the letter on page 238
(A chorus of groans emerge from your classmates.)

Speaker: Mr. Harrison
Text: "I don't want to hear it. I'll be nice and let you partner work this time, so stop complaining."

Speaker: Emily
Text: "So... you wanna work together?"
(As you work with Emily, you keep an eye on the door for Kit.)
(Halfway into the class period, you realize that you missed Kit's entrance. Kit sits at his desk with the origami envelope nowhere to be found.)
fade to black

Speaker: NARR
Text: After School :0
(You make your way to the location you specified in the envelope you left on Kit’s desk.)
(Surprisingly, Kit is already there.)

Speaker: You
Text: He looks angry... I don't think he's going to tell me anything.
(As you get closer to Kit, he holds a piece of crumpled paper out towards you. It is the same color as the origami you left on his desk.)
(...On closer inspection... That *is* the origami you gave him this morning.)

Speaker: You
Text: "Hey Kit!"

Speaker: Kit
Text: "You need to stop."

Speaker: You
Text: "Weird start but okay? Do you want to elaborate on that statement?"
(Kit sighs and motions for you to take the paper he's holding out and doesn't continue talking until you've taken it.)

Speaker: Kit
Text: "My friends tell me you've been acting really weird about me recently. They didn't really get into the specifics of it, but either way I'd like you to stop."

Speaker: You
Text: "Sorry, I'll stop, but before that, I want to ask you a few ques-"

Speaker: Kit
Text: "No."

Speaker: Kit
Text: "I want you to forget about the whole situation."

Speaker: You
Text: "Wait whats wrong with asking a few questions??"

Speaker: Kit
Text: "Don't get involved in things that don't concern you. You might get hurt if you keep nosing around like that.

Speaker: You
Text: "…Are you threatening me? Wait no- you know what I want to ask you."

Speaker: You
Text: "You're getting a little aggressive, Kit. Is there some shady business you want to keep hidden?"

Speaker: You
Text: "Kit are you in the mafia??? Am I talking to a mafia boss??? Oh this is so cool. Did you just forget to pay me off to act like you weren't missing?"
(Kit stares at you after your outburst with disbelief written all over his face.)

Speaker: Kit
Text: "…..what the actual shit is going on in your brain. No, I'm not a mafia boss."

Speaker: You
Text: Hm. That's awkward. He sounded like a movie villain for a second and I got a little carried away with my imagination.

Speaker: You
Text: "Um."

Speaker: Kit
Text: "Forget it. Just stay out of my business. Nothing good will come out of it."

Speaker: Kit
Text: "I'm not a mafia boss, but I need you to promise me that you won't ask any more questions."

Speaker: You
Text: "Are you kidding me? You went missing for a month and a half, come back with no explanation, and for some reason everyone I talk to doesn't remember anything."
"It's like all of their memories are being blocked. I show them evidence, they remember for like, two seconds, and then immediately forget."
"You want me to just act like that isn't a thing?"

Speaker: You
Text: "Fuck off."

Speaker: Kit
Text: "Okay let's say I do answer all of your questions and you have all the information you want. What would you do with that?"

Speaker: You
Text: "I mean, I guess it would depend on what the information is."

Speaker: Kit
Text: "If you don't know what you'll do with it, why are you trying to get it?"

Speaker: You
Text: I feel like curiosity would not be the right answer to give here. Kit looks genuinely upset.

Speaker: Kit
Text: "Either way, you're not going to be able to change the past, or do anything for my future."

Speaker: Kit
Text: "So why would I want to tell you anything?"

Speaker: Kit
Text: "Just give up."

Speaker: You
Text: ... He's... not wrong. Given his extreme reaction, I probably wouldn't be able to do anything with the answers.

Speaker: You
Text: Ugh, not knowing will bother me for the rest of my life, but I think I should back off for now.

Speaker: You
Text: "Okay, you win. I'll stop being nosy. I'm not happy about it, though."

Speaker: Kit
Text: "Thanks."
(There is an awkward silence for a few seconds.)

Speaker: You
Text: "I'll be going then... Uh. See you tomorrow."

Speaker: Kit
Text: "Yeah. I'll-"
(Kit suddenly stops and lunges forward.)

Speaker: Kit
Text: "WATCH OUT!"
fade to black
